column4: France says Cisco to invest 100 million euros in French startups
column5: PARIS U.S. network equipment maker Cisco Systems Inc. plans to invest $100 million in French start-ups  French Prime Minister Manuel Valls' office said on Monday.

column4: France says Cisco to invest 100 mln euros in French startups
column5: PARIS  Feb 16 U.S. network equipment maker Cisco Systems Inc. plans to invest $100 million in French start-ups  French Prime Minister Manuel Valls' office said on Monday.

column4: UPDATE 2-Russian researchers expose breakthrough U.S. spying program
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  Feb 16 The U.S. National Security Agency has figured out how to hide spying software deep within hard drives made by Western Digital  Seagate  Toshiba and other top manufacturers  giving the agency the means to eavesdrop on the majority of the world's computers  according to cyber researchers and former operatives.

column4: AstraZeneca's patent on asthma drug invalidated by U.S. court
column5: NEW YORK A U.S. federal judge ruled late on Friday that AstraZeneca PLC's patent on its Pulmicort Repsules treatment for asthma was invalid  opening up the market to a second  cheaper generic version.

column4: AstraZeneca's patent on asthma drug invalidated by U.S. court
column5: NEW YORK  Feb 15 A U.S. federal judge ruled late on Friday that AstraZeneca PLC's patent on its Pulmicort Repsules treatment for asthma was invalid  opening up the market to a second  cheaper generic version.

column4: Australia's Fortescue first-half profit plunges on weaker iron ore price
column5: SYDNEY Fortescue Metals Group  Australia's third biggest iron ore miner  posted a 81 percent dive in first-half profits after a halving in the price of the steel making ingredient hammered margins and outweighed record production.

column4: BHP agrees to sell Pakistan gas business
column5: MELBOURNE  Feb 16 BHP Billiton   has agreed to sell its Pakistan gas business to a local firm  a unit of the Hashoo Group  for an undisclosed sum  the global miner said on Monday.

column4: BRIEF-SES says orders new SES-15 satellite from Boeing
column5: * Has ordered its new SES-15 satellite to provide growth capacity in North America and capture business potential in vibrant market segments

column4: Deutsche Bank eyes slimmed-down universal bank model - paper
column5: FRANKFURT  Feb 16 Deutsche Bank is focusing on plans for a slimmed-down universal bank as part of the management's strategic review where the group remains internationally engaged in most of its current activities but pulls out of unprofitable regions and business lines  newspaper Handelsblatt reported on Monday.

column4: Ford guns for China's app addicts  seeks WeChat tie-up
column5: BEIJING Ford Motor Co  wants Tencent Holdings Ltd  to tailor its popular chatting app for the firm's cars in China  as automakers in the world's largest market vie for drivers that care about high-tech features as much as engine size.

column4: Ford guns for China's app addicts  seeks WeChat tie-up
column5: * Tencent messaging app has largely overtaken traditional texting

column4: Indonesia lifts demand on Freeport to build Papua smelter -media
column5: JAKARTA  Feb 16 Indonesia has dropped its demand that Freeport-McMoran Inc build a $1.5 billion copper smelter in Papua province  saying a regionally owned enterprise would take on the project instead  website Detik.com reported  quoting the mining minister.

column4: GM gets 75 more claims for faulty ignition switch compensation
column5: General Motors Co has received 75 claims for compensation for ignition switch defects in its cars last week  bringing the total to 4 312  the official administering the compensation program said on Monday.

column4: UPDATE 2-UK financial watchdog investigates HSBC over tax claims
column5: LONDON  Feb 16 Britain's financial watchdog said it was investigating HSBC following reports it helped clients evade taxes but said it was focusing on the bank's current behaviour rather than alleged past abuses.

column4: UK financial watchdog says working closely with HSBC over tax allegations
column5: LONDON  Feb 16 Britain's financial watchdog said it was working closely with HSBC and other agencies to make sure the bank was meeting proper conduct standards following allegations the bank's Swiss unit helped hundreds of people to dodge tax.

column4: HSBC says sorry over past standards at Swiss bank
column5: LONDON HSBC apologized to customers and investors on Sunday for past practices at its Swiss private bank after allegations that it helped hundreds of clients to dodge taxes.

column4: Infosys buys U.S. automation tech firm for enterprise value of $200 million
column5: Infosys Ltd said on Monday it would buy Panaya Inc  a New Jersey-based provider of automation technology  for an enterprise value of $200 million as India's second-biggest IT outsourcing company bets on new technology to boost growth.

column4: Infosys buys US automation tech firm for enterprise value of $200 mln
column5: Feb 16 Infosys Ltd said on Monday it would buy Panaya Inc  a New Jersey-based provider of automation technology  for an enterprise value of $200 million as India's second-biggest IT outsourcing company bets on new technology to boost growth.

column4: Morgan Stanley has 5 pct of Italy's World Duty Free-filing
column5: MILAN  Feb 16 U.S. bank Morgan Stanley  has a 5 percent stake in Italian travel retailer World Duty Free since Feb. 5  Italian market watchdog Consob said in a filing on Monday.

column4: BRIEF-SES-Luxembourg government JV orders satellite from Orbital ATK
column5: * Procurement of a new satellite jointly with Luxembourg government

column4: UPDATE 3-China's Anbang near $1 bln deal for S.Korea's Tong Yang Life-source
column5: * Acquisition would give Anbang investment base in South Korea

column4: UPDATE 2-Rolls-Royce says no contact from Brazil over bribery allegations
column5: LONDON  Feb 16 Rolls-Royce has not been approached by authorities in Brazil regarding bribery allegations made by a former Petrobras manager in a corruption scandal engulfing the state oil company  the British engineering company said on Monday.

column4: Phillips 66 Partners to expand Texas operations in $1 billion deal
column5: Phillips 66 Partners LP  said it would buy Phillips 66's  interests in three pipeline systems for a total of $1.01 billion to expand its operations in Texas.

column4: UPDATE 1-Phillips 66 Partners to expand Texas operations in $1 bln deal
column5: Feb 16 Phillips 66 Partners LP said it would buy Phillips 66's interests in three pipeline systems for a total of $1.01 billion to expand its operations in Texas.

column4: Sanofi to name Bayer's Brandicourt as CEO this week-Le Figaro
column5: PARIS  Feb 16 French drugs group Sanofi  is set to announce this week that Olivier Brandicourt  head of Bayer AG's healthcare business  will become its new chief executive  le Figaro newspaper reported on Monday citing information it had obtained.
